channel.title: NYT > World
channel.copyright: Copyright 2014 The New York Times Company

item.title: Palestinian Factions Agree to Resolve Differences, Leaders Say
item.description: Government news media reported that the leaders of Hamas and Fatah had made progress on the sticking points of their five-month-old reconciliation pact.
item.dc:creator: By JODI RUDOREN

item.title: Listening Post: Tunisians Following a Path of Less Rancor
item.description: Tunisia is an Arab Spring success story, which its president says may be because it has few tribal or religious cleavages like its more chaotic neighbors.
item.category: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER
item.media:description: Moncef Marzouki, president of Tunisia, at the United Nations on Thursday.

item.title: Deborah Cavendish, Last Mitford Sister and Savior of Grand Estate, Dies at 94
item.description: The dowager duchess of Devonshire was an author and businesswoman who helped turned her husband’s ancestral estate into one of England’s successful grand country houses.
item.dc:creator: By ROBERT D. McFADDEN
item.media:credit: Jonathan Player for The New York Times
item.media:description: Deborah Cavendish, the Duchess of Devonshire, at her home, Chatsworth, in 2003. She transformed Chatsworth, a 16th-century mansion, into a self-sustaining family business.

item.title: Memo From Iraq: ISIS’ Harsh Brand of Islam Is Rooted in Austere Saudi Creed
item.description: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, the leader of the Islamic State, adheres to Wahhabism, a severe form of Islam quick to denounce others, even fellow militant groups like Al Qaeda.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
item.media:description: Abu Bakr al-Baghdadi, seen in an image from a video released by the Islamic State in July.

item.title: Global Response to Ebola Is Too Slow, Obama Warns
item.description: At a United Nations meeting on the outbreak, President Obama said the world was doing too little and “not moving fast enough.”
item.dc:creator: By MARK LANDLER and SOMINI SENGUPTA

item.title: Pakistani Guard Attacks British Prisoner Convicted of Blasphemy
item.description: The 70-year-old inmate, who is of Pakistani descent and was convicted of blasphemy after being accused of claiming to be a prophet, survived the attack, officials said.
item.dc:creator: By WAQAR GILLANI

item.title: Iraqi Leader Says ISIS Militants Plotted Against Subways
item.description: The Iraqi prime minister, Haider al-Abadi, said Islamic State fighters seized in Iraq had spoken of plots to bomb subways in Europe and the United States.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By MICHAEL R. GORDON

item.title: ISIS Revenue Sources Remain Crucial Target, U.S. Says
item.description: American, Saudi and Emirati planes hit 12 oil refineries in Syria on Thursday in an effort to cut the Islamic State’s ability to fund its operations.
item.category: United States Defense and Military Forces
Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By HELENE COOPER and ANNE BARNARD

item.title: Runner-Up in Afghan Vote Strikes a Conciliatory Tone
item.description: In a speech, Abdullah Abdullah congratulated the president-elect, Ashraf Ghani, and confirmed that he would accept a senior position in the government.
item.dc:creator: By DECLAN WALSH

item.title: Modi Defies Expectations With Mix of Soft and Severe in India
item.description: India’s new prime minister, Narendra Modi, has shown caution on the economy while seeking fundamental changes in the way the government functions.
item.dc:creator: By ELLEN BARRY
item.media:description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi of India spoke during the nation's Independence Day celebrations last month in New Delhi.

item.title: Emirates’ First Female Fighter Pilot Led Mission in Syria
item.description: Maj. Mariam Al Mansouri, the United Arab Emirates’ first female fighter pilot, led a strike by the country’s fighter jets against Islamic State targets in Syria.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By KAREN ZRAICK
item.media:credit: Emirates News Agency, WAM, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Maj. Mariam Al Mansouri, the United Arab Emirates' first female fighter pilot, prepared for takeoff on a flight last year.

item.title: Iran’s President Says West’s Blunders Helped ISIS Rise
item.description: The president of Iran, Hassan Rouhani, said the West and Arab states should apologize for “blunders” that he said had given rise to extremist groups.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By SOMINI SENGUPTA
item.media:description: President Hassan Rouhani of Iran addressed the United Nations General Assembly on Thursday in New York.

item.title: Ebola Epidemic Worsening, Sierra Leone Increases Quarantine Restrictions
item.description: More than a quarter of Sierra Leone is now sealed off after officials placed quarantine restrictions on hundreds of thousands more citizens.
item.dc:creator: By ADAM NOSSITER

item.title: Ukrainian President Sets Sights on Closer Ties With E.U.
item.description: Speaking at a news conference in Kiev, the capital, President Petro O. Poroshenko suggested that Ukraine would ultimately seek membership of the bloc.
item.dc:creator: By DAVID M. HERSZENHORN
item.media:description: President Petro O. Poroshenko of Ukraine spoke on Thursday at a news conference in Kiev.

item.title: Women’s Rights Activist Executed by Islamic State in Iraq
item.description: Sameera Salih Ali al-Nuaimy, an Iraqi lawyer known for her work promoting women’s rights, was killed by a firing squad after she posted comments on Facebook condemning the militant group.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Death Toll in Xinjiang Violence May Be Higher Than Reported
item.description: Witnesses and Western news media indicate that more than a dozen people were killed and about 100 wounded in the western Chinese region over the weekend.
item.dc:creator: By DAN LEVIN

item.title: Contributing Op-Ed Writer: Doubt as a Sign of Faith
item.description: Like many religious people, the archbishop of Canterbury admits to having occasional uncertainties about belief.
item.dc:creator: By JULIA BAIRD

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Guangdong Sees Surge in Dengue Fever Cases
item.description: Guangdong, China’s most populous province, has seen about 7,500 cases of dengue this year, Xinhua reported. Most years, Guangdong sees fewer than 1,000 cases of dengue, a mosquito-borne disease.
item.dc:creator: By AUSTIN RAMZY
item.media:credit: National Institute of Infectious Diseases, via Associated Press
item.media:description: Health officials cite unusually warm temperatures and high rainfall for the spread of the mosquito-borne disease.

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Afghanistan’s Failed Transformation
item.description: If the country is to survive in one piece, its new leaders must act fast to correct the failures of the last decade.
item.dc:creator: By AHMED RASHID

item.title: Ebola Death Toll Is More Than 2,900, W.H.O. Says
item.description: The disease is spreading rapidly in Liberia and Sierra Leone, but the situation in Guinea seems to have stabilized, the United Nations health body said.
item.dc:creator: By NICK CUMMING-BRUCE

item.title: Op-Ed Contributor: Jailing of Ilham Tohti Will Radicalize More Uighurs
item.description: The silencing of a critic risks accelerating a vicious circle of discrimination and violence in China's west.
item.dc:creator: By NICHOLAS BEQUELIN

item.title: Philippines Says Local Terrorist Group Is Not Linked to ISIS
item.description: The denial came despite threats from the Islamist rebel group Abu Sayyaf that it would kill two German captives unless Germany stopped supporting the fight against the Islamic State.
item.category: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
item.dc:creator: By FLOYD WHALEY

item.title: British Police Arrest 9 in Antiterror Sweep
item.description: The detainees were said to include Anjem Choudhury, a preacher who has expressed support for radical Islamists and frequently courted official disapproval.
item.dc:creator: By ALAN COWELL

item.title: United Nations General Assembly: Hassan Rouhani Hints at ISIS and Nuclear Gaps to Be Bridged
item.description: The Obama administration’s plan for bombings and airstrikes, Mr. Rouhani said, is illegal, inappropriate and flawed.
item.dc:creator: By RICK GLADSTONE

item.title: Sinosphere Blog: Xinhua Details Charges in Case Against Ilham Tohti
item.description: China’s state-run news agency, Xinhua, has published a lengthy account of the trial of Ilham Tohti, the Uighur intellectual who was sentenced to life on charges of separatism.
item.dc:creator: By CHRIS BUCKLEY
item.media:description: Uighur women in Urumqi grieved on July 7, 2009, for the men they said were taken away by the authorities after deadly riots that prosecutors allege Ilham Tohti helped instigate through his writings.
